thread.title: Trojans march past Mariners in late-season Class C showdown
thread.title_full: Trojans march past Mariners in late-season Class C showdown

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Trojans march past Mariners in late-season Class C showdown
text:
Trojans march past Mariners in late-season Class C showdown By Staff | Oct 19, 2015 
Bar Harbor â€” The up-and-down, back-and-forth season for the Oceanside football team continued on Friday night, Oct. 16 as the Mariners traveled to face Mount Desert Island in a game that carried playoff implications for both squads. 
Oceanside hung with MDI through the first quarter, but the floodgates opened in the second and third as the hosts pulled away with a 42-13 high school gridiron victory. 
The game was scoreless after the first quarter, while MDI led 22-7 at halftime and 36-7 after three quarters. 
Brandon DeBrosky finished 8-of-10 under center for Oceanside for 133 yards and a touchdown, while quarterback Andrew Phelps was 3-of-7 for 116 yards for MDI. 
Leading the Mariner rushing attack were Nate Raye (15 carries for 37 yards), Michael Norton Jr. (10 carries for 34 yards), Isaiah Green (8 carries for 32 yards), DeBrosky (9 carries for 5 yards, TD) and Logan Sheridan (2 carries for 4 yards). 
Riley Sprague also hauled in four passes for 75 yards and a TD, while Raye (3 catches for 33 yards), Norton (2 catches for 19 yards) and Green (6-yard catch) also had grabs for the visitors. 
Leading the Trojans on the ground were Taner Bickford (11 carries for 122 yards, TD), Croix Albee (10 carries for 70 yards, TD), Colby Lee (7 carries for 49 yards, TD, 2-point conversion), Elijah Joyce (4 carries for 14 yards), Nick Soper (4 carries for 13 yards, TD), Billy Kerley (carry for 12 yards), Chris Farnsworth (carry for 6 yards) and Abraham Malloy (carry for 3 yards). 
Bickford also hauled in a 22-yard touchdown catch, while Lee had two catches for 94 yards for the Trojans. 
MDI started the scoring on the first play of the second quarter, as Oceanside punted the ball to Trojan Drew Rich, who promptly returned it for a touchdown. The hosts led 8-0 after the two-point conversion. 
Oceanside responded quickly when DeBrosky hooked up with Sprague on a 49-yard scoring pass and found itself down 8-7, but MDI scored the game's next 28 points as the hosts marched to their sixth win. 
DeBrosky cashed in on a run from three yards out in the fourth quarter to round out the Oceanside scoring. 
Oceanside will host Belfast in its regular-season finale, while MDI could clinch one of the top two seeds in Class C North with a win over unbeaten Old Town. Both games are Friday, Oct. 23 at 7 p.m. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Crabtree Point Standings for Class C North, Oceanside (3-4, 94.6857 points) is seventh, while Old Town (7-0, 137.5000 points) is first in the 10-team region. The top eight teams qualify for the playoffs.
